loan.use: Pigs

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to pay school fees for her daughter and also expand her business

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. 41 years of age has been a member since 2003. Her very first loan of 2.000.000d was invested in the business of mat weaving. The initial loan used prove to be a success and since been borrowing and obtaining more capital for the business. Her daily income is 150.000d. Presently, her children are grown, the two eldest have jobs of their own bringing in a monthly income of 3.000.000d. She is requesting a loan of 12.000.000d to buy more raw materials for mat making. Her average income is 6.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Services

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. is 52 years of age. She has been a member since 2006, the home where her family reside sits on a main road and is a very ideal and convenient location for an auto part store. She was able to borrow 3.000.000 on her first loan, which she used as capital to buy a variety of rubber rope products (timing belts) to sell out of her home; averaging 60.000d/day. After seeing the success of her business, she was able to expand her business, offering products such as automobiles rims and tires. This special inventory demands a higher capital; therefore she is requesting a larger loan amount. The auto part business has been a success; in 2007 she was able to purchase a truck to help aid in transporting her inventory. This time she is requesting a loan of 9.000.000d to use as principal for the new inventory. Her average income is about 7.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Services

loan.name: Elise

texts.fr: Dame A. Elise est nÃ©e vers 1968 Ã BOPA dans le dÃ©partement du MONO. Elle est mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de trois enfants que sont Elodie 16 ans et en apprentissage, Natacha 13 ans est au cours secondaire et Lucas est au cours Ã©lÃ©mentaire 2. Dame A. Elise est revendeuse des tubercules d'igname sÃ©chÃ©es dont la farine sert Ã prÃ©parer de la pÃ¢te appelÃ©e au BÃ©nin "TELIBO". Elle sollicite ce prÃªt pour augmenter son volume d'activitÃ© et pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elise A. was born around 1968 in BOPA in the department of MONO. She is married and has three children : Elodie, 16 years old, is an apprentice, Natacha, 13 years old, is in secondary school, and Lucas is in elementary school. Mrs. Elise A. is a retailer of dried yam tubers, which can be made into flour and used to make a paste called "TELIBO" in Benin. She is asking for this loan to increase the volume of her business and to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 3 bags of dried yam tubers and various other products

loan.name: Florentine

texts.fr: Dame A. Florentine est nÃ©e le 01 Septembre 1982 Ã LomÃ© (TOGO). DivorcÃ©e, elle est mÃ¨re d'un enfant; Ronaldo ATALEY Ã¢gÃ© de 5 ans et scolarisÃ©. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits de consommation courante dans le marchÃ© de GbÃ©gamey qui est l'un des marchÃ©s de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activitÃ© depuis cinq ans. Avant cette activitÃ© elle faisait la distribution vente. Elle assure seule l'Ã©ducation de son enfant et les charges familiales. Le but essentiel de sa demande de crÃ©dit est de renforcer sa capacitÃ© financiÃ¨re afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa clientÃ¨le.
texts.en:
Mrs.Florentine A. was born on September 1, 1982 in LomÃ© (TOGO). She is divorced and the mother of one child; Ronaldo ATALEY, 5 years old and attending school. She sells various every day goods in the market in GbÃ©gamey, one of the markets in Cotonou. She has been running this business for 5 years. Before this activity she was in the supply/ sale business. She, alone, provides for the education of her child and for the needs of the family. The essential goal of this loan request is to strengthen her financial ability in order to provide for the needs of her clients.


Translated from French by VÃ©ronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of 2 bags of rice, one box of canned food, and 2 boxes of pasta

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase construction materials like cement, ballast, timber, etc.

loan.name: KingnikÃ©

texts.fr: Dame A. KingnikÃ© est nÃ©e vers 1965 Ã Cotonou dans le dÃ©partement du Littoral au sud du BÃ©nin. Originaire de la rÃ©gion de l'OuÃ©mÃ© au sud-est du BÃ©nin, elle est mariÃ©e Ã NOUVOESSI Zamba agent de la SociÃ©tÃ© BÃ©ninoise de Manutention Portuaire (SOBEMAP). Elle est mÃ¨re de 3 enfants. Elle vend de l'acajou et s'approvisionne Ã KILIBO, DASSA et ABOMEY. Elle vend dans les pays de la sous rÃ©gion comme le NIGERIA, le TOGO, ABIDJAN et Ã©galement dans les marchÃ©s locaux de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activitÃ© depuis 25 ans environ et rÃ©alise un chiffre d'affaire mensuel moyen de 250 000 francs. ParallÃ¨lement Ã cette activitÃ©, elle vend aussi du repas prÃªt Ã manger et est Ã son quatriÃ¨me crÃ©dit Ã ALIDÃ©. Elle sollicite ce prÃªt pour renforcer son activitÃ© et satisfaire davantage ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. KingnikÃ© A. was born around 1965 in Cotonou, in the county of Littoral in the south of BÃ©nin. Originally from the OuÃ©mÃ© region in the southeast of BÃ©nin, she is married to Zamba NOUVOESSI, an officer of the SOBEMAP [long-shoring society of Benin], and is the mother of three children. She sells cashews and gets her supplies in KILIBO, DASSA, and ABOMEY. She makes sales in the countries of the sub-regions, such as NIGERIA, TOGO, ABIDJAN and also in local marketplaces in Cotonou. She has been in this business for about 25 years and produces monthly sales figures of about 250,000 francs. Concurrent to this business, she also sells ready-to-eat meals and is on her fourth loan with AlidÃ©. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 10 sacks of cashew nuts, 100 empty bottles, 2 sacks of cassava flour, and 100 kg of corn.

loan.name: GÃ©ronime

texts.fr: Dame N. GÃ©ronime est nÃ©e le 30 Septembre 1961 Ã Cotonou dans le dÃ©partment du Littoral. Elle est originaire de la ville historique Ouidah. MariÃ©e, elle est mÃ¨re de deux enfants; DieudonnÃ© qui est agent des Forces ArmÃ©es BÃ©ninonises (FAB) et Armande qui est revendeuse de divers. Dame N. GÃ©ronime est revendeuse de divers produits de mÃ©nage et va s'approvisionner dans le marchÃ© de Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activitÃ© depuis quinze ans environ. Elle sollicite ce prÃªt pour augmenter sa capacitÃ© financiÃ¨re et satisfaire les besoins de sa clientÃ¨le.
texts.en:
Ms. GÃ©ronime N. was born on September 30, 1961 in Cotonou in the county of Littoral. She is originally from the historic city of Ouidah. Married, she is the mother of two children: DieudonnÃ©, who is an officer of the FAB [the armed forces of Benin], and Armande, who is a retailer of various goods. Ms. GÃ©ronime N. is a retailer of various household goods and is going to gets supplies from the Dantokpa marketplace in Cotonou. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. She is requesting this loan to increase her financial capacity and to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 2 boxes of detergent, 1 box of condensed milk, 24 cans of sardines, 1 box of pasta, 1 box of soap, and other goods

loan.name: Hekima Group

texts.en:
Tabu has owned a cafe and clothes-sales business in Dar es Salaam since 2002. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children ages 6, 9, 15, and 23. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $300. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to buy more goods at bulk rates to sell for a greater profit at her store.

Tabu will share this loan with her fellow group members who also have shops in Dar es Salaam.

loan.use: To buy more goods for business.

loan.name: Upendo (Delete This Enterpreneur) Group

texts.en:
Zena has owned a salon in Dar Es Salaam since 2007. She is 25 years old, married, and has one 7-year-old child. She works daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm at her salon. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $150, but she is hoping that taking out this loan will help her to expand her business and increase her profit. She intends to purchase lotions and other items for the salon with the loan.

Zena will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members. Businesses of the group members include charcoal, clothing, and fabric sales.

loan.use: To buy lotion and other items for salon.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase stock

loan.name: Isabella Mgaya's Upendo Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
Isabella M., 42, is married with four children (ages 22, 18, 11, and 8). She has a general store which she started 4 years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $87.

Isabella has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to build a small house. She now hopes for a new loan to buy a big stock of rice from upcounty. Isabella will share this loan with her subgroup members with businesses selling cereals, vegetables, chicken feed, and also a food vendor.

In the photo Isabella is 1st on the left.

loan.use: To buy up a large stock of rice from upcountry

loan.name: Flora's Hekima Group

texts.en:
Flora is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children ages 21,15, 12, and 9. She has been a milk and banana seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Flora now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize and banana sales, milk and egg sales.

loan.use: To buy more bananas and milk for her business

loan.name: AÃ¯cha

texts.fr:
AÃ¯cha B. is 38, married, and has four children. She would like to develop her small palm oil-selling business. She would like to improve her familyâ€™s standard of living and would one day like to build her own store. This is her first loan, and she intends to repay it in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

AÃ¯cha B. 38 ans, est mariÃ©e et a 04 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce dâ€™huile de palme. Elle veut amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de la famille et envisage Ã  construire plus tard son propre magasin. Voici son premier prÃªt quâ€™elle compte rembourser en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance au bout de six mois.

loan.use: Develop her small palm oil-selling business

loan.name: Yanina

texts.en:
Yanina is married. She has one son, Maxim. Yanina started a small business motivated by sheer necessity to have a means to live. Today she runs a kiosk selling household items and other small necessities. She has been in business for 12 years. She has about $2400 invested in her business.

Yanina is very sociable and lively. Her efforts, dedication and rich experience of work in the sphere of market trade have helped her keep and expand this business. Her natural talent to get a wide assortment of practical items for sale helps Yanina find her market and be successful in her business. Yanina is requesting a loan to invest in increasing her inventory. She wants to purchase a range of practical items that always sell well. The loan in combination with constant hard work and willingness to serve clients' needs will promote growth of her business and increase of her earnings.

loan.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loan.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold P. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur engaged in the business of wholesaling and retailing, selling a variety of items including big and small bags. He purchases some items from the wholesale shops in Kariakoo business center, and others are imported from Zanzibar. His business area is at Mchikichini Matching Guy's business center. He need a loan of US$ 1200 to expand his business.

loan.use: To expand his business

loan.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is an entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells clothing items in the central market. She has been in business for about 6 years. Presently, Dina has about $8000 invested in her business.

Dina is a disciplined and responsible entrepreneur who likes accuracy in her work with clients and order in all business procedures. Dina is very consistent and thorough and handles challenging situations with stunning determination and stamina. She is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan to increase her turnover capital. Dina admits she needs financial support as her business continues to grow and develop. She is hoping to increase assorted inventory and her proceeds as a result. We believe her communication and managing skills will help this client achieve stability and success in business as well as financial independence.

loan.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loan.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Alima K. is married and has three children in her care. She would like a loan that will enable her to bolster her small business selling diverse food items at the market. This work will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and to provide for their needs. She is going repay the loan all at once at then end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Alima K., est mariÃ©e et avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite un prÃªt qui lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce de denrÃ©es alimentaires diverses au marchÃ©. Cette activitÃ© lui permettra dâ€™amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de subvenir Ã  leurs besoins. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.

loan.use: Commerce in diverse food items for retail sale

loan.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and lives with her husband in the town of Pavlograd in central Ukraine. After Ludmila had resigned from her last job she couldn't find a new job in her field for a while. Her family was facing a tough financial situation at the time, so she decided to take a risk and start her own small business. Today Ludmila runs a small kiosk selling shoes and clothing in the local market. Currently, she has 4 vending facilities in the same marketplace and about $16,000 invested in inventory.

Ludmila is a determined entrepreneur. She has been in business for about 20 years. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Ludmila recognizes that financial assistance from "Nadiya Ukraine" has provided significant support for her business and has promoted its stable growth. Ludmila is requesting a loan for 5000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital, which will allow her to re-supply her inventory and increase her sales. Eventually, Ludmila Anna is hoping to rent a bigger vending facility and open her own little shoe store. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance and diligent work will someday help her dream come true.

loan.use: To purchase seasonal footwear and clothing

loan.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is married. She worked for a time as a market vendor. Financial problems brought out her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start her own small business. Today she has a small kiosk selling casual outerwear for women in one of the local markets. Moreover, Lyubov also owns a hairdressing business offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her clients. She has been in this business for about 2 years.

Lyubov is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Lyubov would like to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise and re-supply her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her clothing trade. Lyubov believes that having an assortment of women's outerwear that is both practical and good quality will increase her sales and offer both warmth and style suitable to any taste and weather.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loan.use: To purchase necessary merchandise

loan.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S., born in 1963, is married and has six children and one other person in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in ThiÃ¨s, for seven years. She wants to buy shoes, incense, and perfume, and to make clothing to sell. Awa wishes to bolster her business in order to better address the needs of her family and to ensure the schooling of her children. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Awa S., nÃ©e en 1963 est mariÃ©e avec 06enfants et 01 autre personne en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly Ã  ThiÃ¨s depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des chaussures, de lâ€™encens, des parfums et confectionner des habits pour vendre. Awa souhaite renforcer son commerce pour mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolaritÃ© de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.

loan.use: Commerce in shoes, clothing, parfume, and incense

loan.name: NdÃ¨ye Anna

texts.fr:
NdÃ¨ye Anna D., age 45, is married and has four children and another person in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in ThiÃ¨s, for seven years. She wants to bolster her commerce in sheets, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and cakes. To do so, she is going to buy some cloth for sheets and pagnes and some flour for making cakes to sell. Her income is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

NdÃ¨ye Anna D., 45 ans, mariÃ©e avec 04enfants et 01 autre personne en charge est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly Ã  ThiÃ¨s depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de draps,de pagne et de gÃ¢teaux. Pour cela, elle va acheter des tissus pour les draps et pagnes et de la farine pour faire les gÃ¢teaux et vendre. Ses revenus vont lui permettre dâ€™amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prÃªt qui sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.

loan.use: Commerce in sheets, pagnes, and cakes

loan.name: NdÃ¨ye Ndioro

texts.fr:
NdÃ¨ye Ndioro F., age 44 ans, is married and has four children, plus four other persons in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in ThiÃ¨s, for three and a half years. She is the manager of a game arcade (foosball, video games). She wants a loan to buy a role-playing video game and to address operating costs, such as electricity. Her income is going to enable her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

NdÃ¨ye Ndioro F., 44 ans, mariÃ©e avec 04enfants et 04 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly Ã  ThiÃ¨s depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle est gÃ©rante dâ€™une salle de jeux. Elle veut un prÃªt pour acheter une maquette de jeu et faire face aux dÃ©penses de fonctionnement comme lâ€™Ã©lectricitÃ©. Ses revenus vont lui permettre dâ€™amÃ©liorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prÃªt quâ€™elle sollicite sera remboursÃ© au bout de six mois en une seule Ã©chÃ©ance.

loan.use: To buy a role-playing video game

loan.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy is 30 years old and is the father of a two-year-old son, named Joseph, who means everything to Roy. He has a wife, Cintia, who supports him as much as possible in his business. He buys and sells rounded and crafted logs; this work takes up most of his day. Sometimes, in order to obtain the wood, he has to travel to different towns by river, which can take 2 or 3 days. He likes that his work allows him to earn a good income so that he can live peacefully and without worries. It is, however, difficult for him to have to travel for long periods of time. Roy work for his daily expenses and for the nourishment of his young son. With the money from the loan, Roy wants to build a place near his home where he can store and sell his wood.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Roy, de 30 aÃ±os es padre de un hijo de 2 aÃ±itos, de nombre Joseph, que es todo para Ã©l. Tiene a su esposa Cintia quien lo apoya en lo posible en su negocio. Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera rolliza y trabajada, esta labor le ocupa casi todo el dÃ­a. A veces para conseguir la madera tiene que viajar hasta los diferentes caserÃ­os, por rÃ­o en un lapso de 2 o 3 dÃ­as. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos para vivir tranquilo y sin preocupaciones. Lo difÃ­cil es tener que viajar por largas temporadas. Roy trabaja para sus gastos diarios y la alimentaciÃ³n de su pequeÃ±o. Con el dinero del prÃ©stamo quiere mandar a construir un local junto a su vivienda para almacenar y vender su madera.

loan.use: To set up a place to store the wood that he sells

loan.name: Winefred

texts.en:
Winefred B. is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish and then processes it for sale. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Winefred and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loan.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loan.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 42 years old; she is single and is the mother of 3 adult children, who live with her and support her a lot. She sells beauty products and plastics, like trays, chairs, tables, pitchers, glasses, etc. She takes these products and sells them in different places; her clients pay her either on credit or with cash. Dolores and her children work all day. She likes that her work allows her to get to know many people with whom she shares ideas about business. Dolores requests this loan so that she can increase her supply of products and rent a place to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolores tiene 42 aÃ±os, es soltera, madre de 3 hijos ya adultos, que viven con ella y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y la venta de plÃ¡sticos (bandejas, sillas, mesas, jarras, vasos y otros), estos productos, los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares, dejÃ¡ndolos al crÃ©dito o al contado a sus clientes. Trabaja todo el dÃ­a junto a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente con quienes comparte ideas de negocio. Dolores pide este prÃ©stamo para implementarse con mÃ¡s productos y alquilar un local para la venta de estos.

loan.use: To increase her merchandise and rent a place where she can sell her goods

loan.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, who is 50 years old, has 6 children, all of whom are professionals and are independent. At present, she lives only with her husband Daniel who is a carpenter and supports her wholly. She sells different varieties of food, like French fries with sausage, â€œjuanes,â€ fish wrapped in leaves, and other regional plates. This activity is carried out outside the house, in a place that is very busy and crowded. She has already spent 7 years in this job. She also the owner of a three-wheeler that her husband drives; he is in charge of its maintenance. She only sells her food at night. She is pleased when people taste her food and tell others about its good flavor. With the money from the loan, she will buy tables and chairs so that her clients are more comfortable. Later, she hopes to buy carp for protection from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz (50 aÃ±os) tiene 6 hijos, todos ya profesionales e independientes. En la actualidad solo vive con su esposo Daniel que se dedica a la carpinterÃ­a y la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en distintas variedades: salchipapas, juanes, pescado envuelto en hoja y otros platos regionales. Esta actividad la realiza fuera de su casa, en un lugar muy transitable y concurrido, tiene ya 7 aÃ±os en esta labor. TambiÃ©n es propietaria de un motocarro que maneja su esposo y es quien se encarga de su mantenimiento. loan.name: Alira
