loan.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
Mrs Julia P. is a 51 year old woman living in barrio 380 in Managua. She is divorced, with a 19 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. The children's father provides support for them. She has a small store in a room in her home, which she began 7 years ago by selling ice and ice cream. She used her last loan to improve her home, and she will use this loan to improve her business. With the money that she is requesting she plans to purchase basic grains and cleaning products to stock her business and to meet the needs of her customers in the neighborhood. This is a very poor neighborhood, and people purchase their daily needs in the small stores. For this reason,Juila must keep her store stocked with products so that her customers do not lose faith in her.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

DoÃ±a Julia P. tiene 51 aÃ±os de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, es divorciada, tiene una hija de 19 aÃ±os de edad y un niÃ±o de 7 aÃ±os de edad, el papÃ¡ le apoya en la manutenciÃ³n de sus dos hijos. Tiene una pulperÃ­a en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, la cual desde hace 7 aÃ±os ha venido administrando, la cual empezÃ³ con ventas de hielo y helados. El crÃ©dito anterior fue usado para mejoras de su hogar pero Ã©ste serÃ¡ usado en la mejora de su negocio, con el dinero solicitado comprarÃ¡ granos bÃ¡sicos y productos de limpieza para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las demandas de sus vecinos del barrio. Este barrio es un barrio pobre, la manera de vivir de la gente es comprar en las pulperÃ­as las necesidades del dÃ­a, es por eso que Julia necesita tener su pulperÃ­a llena de sus productos para asÃ­ no quedar mal a sus clientes.

loan.use: Purchase of basic grains and cleaning products

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth C. is a 33 year old young woman who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She and her husband, who works cleaning rooms, have an 8 year old daughter. Each of them work hard every day to give her a better life. Elizabeth has worked taking in outside laundry and ironing for the last 4 years. She began working when she saw the need to help her husband with the household expenses, and alsobecause she wanted to finish building their home. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials which they will be used to build a room for their daughter, to give her greater comfort and privacy. Elizabeth hopes to find better work which will help her progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth C. es una joven de 33 aÃ±os, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es casada, su esposo es recamarero, tienen una niÃ±a de 8 aÃ±os de edad, por la que trabajan diariamente para darle una vida mejor. Elizabeth trabaja lavando y planchando ajeno, hace 4 aÃ±os que se dedica a esta actividad. Se vio en la necesidad de buscar trabajo para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, y porque tambiÃ©n querÃ­an terminar de construir su hogar. El prÃ©stamo serÃ¡ usado para la compra de materiales de construcciÃ³n para hacer un cuarto para su pequeÃ±a hija y asÃ­ darle comodidad y mayor privacidad. Elizabeth espera poder encontrar un mejor trabajo que le permita desarrollarse en la vida

loan.use: Construction of a room for her daughter

loan.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Manuela is a 38 year old married woman who lives in barrio 380. She has two children, ages 8 and 13. Her husband works in security services and provides for the expenses of the home. Maunuela sells tortillas and boiled beans - a business that she started with her own money 4 years ago to help out with family expenses. With the money that she is requesting from this loan, she will invest in infrastructure - purchasing construction material to add on to a bedroom in order to improve conditions. She plans on eventually opening a small store, finishing work on her home, and allowing her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Manuela tiene 37 aÃ±os de edad, habita en el barrio 380, es casada, y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 13 aÃ±os de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad y aporta a los gastos del hogar. DoÃ±a Manuela vende tortillas y frijoles cosidos, tiene cuatro aÃ±os de experiencias y comenzÃ³ con dinero propio para aportar a los gastos de la familia. Con el prÃ©stamo que estÃ¡ solicitando es para infraestructura, para comprar materiales de construcciÃ³n para realizar una extensiÃ³n de una habitaciÃ³n, para estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes son poder llegar a tener una pulperÃ­a, terminar de construir su casa y brindar estudios a sus hijos.

loan.use: Addition to a bedroom

loan.name: JosÃ© Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jose is a married 20 year old man who lives n barrio 380. His wife is a homemaker. Jose works for a private company as a sales representative, a position that he has held for one year. His wife is pregnant with their first child, which will be born in a few months. For this reason, Jose would like to build onto his home to improve their quality of life for the new baby. With the money that he is requesting, he will build a room onto their home so that they can be more comfortable. In the future, Jose would like to save enough money to open a beauty salon that his wife would run.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

JosÃ© tiene 20 aÃ±os de edad, habita en el barrio 380, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa. Don JosÃ© trabaja en una empresa privada desempeÃ±Ã¡ndose como ejecutivo de ventas tiene un aÃ±o de estar laborando. La esposa de JosÃ© estÃ¡ embarazada su bebÃ© nacerÃ¡ en pocos meses, por lo que desea construir su hogar para darle mejor calidad de vida a su bebÃ©. Con el dinero que estÃ¡ solicitando es para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda para estar mÃ¡s cÃ³modos. Desea en un futuro reunir capital para poner un salÃ³n de belleza para que lo administre su esposa.

loan.use: Construction of a room.

loan.name: Shouman

texts.en: S., a 48-years-old married man, lives with his wife and 2 children in Baalbek, located in the Bekaa valley. S. sells second-hand clothes. The loan he is requesting, USD 1200, will be used to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to diversify the selection he can offer to his clients. This is the first time S. has requested a loan from Al Majmoua; his background makes him a good candidate for a loan.

loan.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise

loan.name: Shealan

texts.en: Shealan, 31 years old and single, lives in Baalbek, located in the Bekaa valley. Shealan is the owner of a pastry shop. He always looks for a way to improve his business and therefore has been able to grow a good base of loyal customers. The loan he is asking for, USD 1000, is to purchase raw materials and thereby diversify his inventory of goods. This is the first time that Shealan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase raw materials to diversify the inventory of goods presented in the pastry shop

loan.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel, presently single, lives in Baalbek, a town located in the Bekaa valley. Kamel is the owner of a shop that sells air conditioning split units.
Kamel decided to get married a couple of months ago. He would like to borrow USD 1,000 to cover the wedding expenses. This is the first time Kamel has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loan.use: Cover wedding expenses

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 24 years old, is the father of two children who are his inspiration and motivation to move forward. Ahmad is the owner of a grocery store.

Ahmad needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,200 to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer a wider choice to his customers and therefore expand his business. This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer a wider choice

loan.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana is single and 36 years old, she has a son who loves her very much. She lives in her parentâ€™s house, they help her with her business.
Bibiana works daily selling beauty products, she works for three lines selling by catalogues, she is a very high spirited woman, and what she sets her mind on she conquers.
This is why she decided to start this business, because it seams profitable to her, she works all day and has one year on this business. What she likes the most is to socialize with other people. Business is good and currently she is leader on one of the lines she works for. Bibiana works to help her parents with daily expenses and for her sonâ€™s education.
With the loan she is asking, she wants to improve her business, and buy a showcase to keep in good condition her products and to exhibit them.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bibiana es soltera, tiene 36 aÃ±os, es madre de un hijo que la ama mucho. Ella vive en casa de sus padres quienes le dan la mano en su negocio. La venta de productos de belleza es el trabajo diario que tiene Bibiana, trabaja para tres lÃ­neas de productos de belleza por catÃ¡logo, es una mujer de armas tomar y lo que se propone, lo cumple. Por eso, decidiÃ³ incursionar en este negocio, ya que le parece rentable, trabaja todo el dÃ­a desde hace ya un aÃ±o. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta es socializar con otras personas. Le va muy bien, actualmente ya es lÃ­der de una de las lÃ­neas para quien trabaja. Bibiana trabaja para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos diarios y para la educaciÃ³n de su hijo. Con el dinero que solicita quiere implementar mÃ¡s su negocio, asÃ­ como tambiÃ©n comprar una vitrina para tener en una buena condiciÃ³n y exhibiciÃ³n sus productos.

loan.use: Stock products and buy a showcase to exhibit her beauty products / ImplementaciÃ³n de mercaderÃ­a y compra de una vitrina para la conservaciÃ³n y exhibiciÃ³n de sus productos de belleza.

loan.name: RocÃ­o

texts.es:
Rocio is 38 years old and has 3 children who study and support her very much. She lives with her husband Claudio who supports her too in her business.
She works selling books on different places in her city, for the past 25 years, she sells them cash or on layaway, her husband is one in charge of taking the books to the clients, while she takes care of collecting the money. She works all day, including Sundays and holidays. What she likes the most is that she knows several places, people and generates good income.
Rocio works to cover her family expenses and to provide education to her children.
The loan she is asking is to rent a place to sell her books.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Rocio, de 38 aÃ±os de edad, es madre de 3 hijos quienes estudian y la apoyan mucho. Ella vive junto con su esposo Claudio quien la apoya mucho en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedades de libros, los vende por los diferentes lugares de su ciudad, esto ya hace 25 aÃ±os; dejÃ¡ndolos al crÃ©dito o al contado, su esposo es el encargado de llevar los pedidos a los clientes, mientras que ella se dedica a la cobranza de los mismos. Trabaja todo el dÃ­a, incluido domingos y feriados. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares, personas y le genera buenos ingresos. RocÃ­o trabaja para solventar sus gastos familiares y la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos. El monto que solicita en prÃ©stamo es para alquilar un local para vender sus libros cÃ³modamente.

loan.use: To rent a space to sell her books / Alquiler de un local para la venta de sus libros.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, 26, is the mother of two marvelous school-age boys who are her reason for being. She lives with her husband JonÃ¡s, who works as a chauffeur. She has been selling clothing and shoes for a long time. Gladys gets up very early to get everything ready before going to sell her products in different locations in her area. She runs the business for nine months a year selling her products every day and sometimes already gives credit to reliable people. Gladys and JonÃ¡s work very carefully to ensure their childrenâ€™s happiness and see them become professionals one day and be able to support their families. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy merchandise and, in the near future, she wants to rent a location for selling her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Gladis, de 26 aÃ±os es madre de 2 hijos maravillosos que estÃ¡n estudiando y son su razÃ³n de ser. Ella vive junto a su esposo JonÃ¡s que trabaja como chofer. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace mucho tiempo. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar todo, para luego llevar a vender sus prendas a los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lleva en este negocio 9 meses, vende todo el dÃ­a y a veces deja a crÃ©dito cuando las personas son de confianza. Gladys y su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos y que en un maÃ±ana sean profesionales y puedan solventar los gastos de sus futuras familias. Con el dinero que solicita quiere adquirir mercaderÃ­a, y en un futuro cercano, alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas.

loan.use: Building up her business inventory (clothing and shoes)

loan.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, 47, is the mother of six, five of whom are independent, and her family remains her responsibility. She lives with her husband, a fisherman, who agrees with what Nelly has decided to do. She has been selling fish and plantains around her neighborhood for six years, and it has gone very well due to the very convenient and busy location. Nelly works from 6 to 10 A.M. What she likes about her store is that it generates a good income that is gradually increasing. What is difficult about the business is not having a booth to provide a better presentation of her products. Nelly works to pay for daily expenses and the education of her son. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to build her booth and stock it with select fish to give special attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, de 47 aÃ±os de edad es madre de 6 hijos, siendo 5 de ellos independientes y de familia, quedando el Ãºltimo a su cargo. Vive con su esposo Ignacio (pescador) quien estÃ¡ de acuerdo con lo que se propone Nelly. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y plÃ¡tano en las fueras de su domicilio, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 6 aÃ±os y le va muy bien ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitable y concurrida. Nelly atiende desde las 6 hasta las 10 de la maÃ±ana. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que le genera buenos ingresos y crece poco a poco. Lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es no tener un kiosco adecuado para dar una mejor presentaciÃ³n a sus productos. Nelly trabaja para los gastos diarios y la educaciÃ³n de su hijo. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir su kiosco e implementarse con pescado selectos y asÃ­ dar una buena atenciÃ³n a sus clientes.

loan.use: Construction of a booth for better convenience and product sales.

loan.name: Salvith

texts.es:
Salvith, 36, and her husband Armando have three children: an infant and two students, whom Salvith adores. Armando, who transports passengers, and Salvith have decided to progress in their lives. Salvith has sold cold items (carbonated beverages, beer, popsicles, etc.) from her house for the past four years starting at noon, and mornings she takes care of children in her home for the Wawasi government program (mothers who look after the children of low-income working women). She likes her jobs for the opportunities of which she has already taken maximum advantage. Sometimes she has to get up at nght when her customers want to buy some cold products. Salvith wants to build a small establishment and set up chairs and tables to give her customers a better reception. That is why she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Salvith es madre de 3 hijos, un bebe y dos estudiantes, quienes son su mayor adoraciÃ³n, ella tiene 36 aÃ±os y vive junto a su esposo Armando, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y junto han decidido salir adelante. Salvith se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (gaseosas, cervezas, chupetes de hielo, entre otros) dentro de su vivienda desde hace 4 aÃ±os, atiende a partir del medio dÃ­a, ya que tambiÃ©n trabaja por las maÃ±anas cuidando niÃ±os con el programa gubernamental Wawasi (son madres que cuidan a los niÃ±os de las mujeres de pocos recursos que salen a trabajar) que se encuentra instalado en su casa. Le gustan sus trabajos, ya que son oportunidades que aprovecha al mÃ¡ximo. A veces tiene que levantarse en la noche cuando sus clientes desean beber algÃºn producto helado. Quiere mandar a construir una ramada e implementarse de mesas sillas y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, este es el motivo por el cual solicita este prÃ©stamo.

loan.use: Setting up a space to sell her drinks and cold products

loan.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda is a dedicated and hard-working 60-year-old woman with two children, one of them already independent and the other a student, who both live with her. Her husband FÃ©lix is a farmer who helps her a lot in her business of selling plantains in her area. She started the business 27 years ago and works at it all day. Florinda does not have to worry about going to buy her plantains because her husband grows them every season. Her work is very profitable, and she has had no problems so far. She is working to pay the household expenses and to educate her son. She wants to invest money in the construction of a booth so that her plantains are better protected.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Florinda es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora, a sus 60 aÃ±os es madre de dos hijos, siendo uno de ellos ya independiente y el otro estudiante, ambos viven con ella, su esposo FÃ©lix es agricultor la apoya mucho en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de plÃ¡tano en las afuera de su vivienda, lleva en este negocio 27 aÃ±os y vende durante todo el dÃ­a. Florinda no se preocupa en ir a comprar plÃ¡tano para venderlo, ya que su esposo se dedica al cultivo del mismo y se lo envÃ­a cada temporada. Su trabajo es muy rentable, y hasta ahora no ha tenido problemas. Trabaja para los gastos del mercado familiar y la educaciÃ³n de su hijo. Quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en la construcciÃ³n de un kiosco para que sus plÃ¡tanos estÃ©n mejor cuidados.

loan.use: Construction of a booth to protect the plantains she sells and make sales more convenient

loan.name: Julia Edilberta

texts.es:
Julia is 50 and lives with her husband Pedro and their six children, who are all adults now and working. Together, the family is trying to improve its standard of living. Julia owns two motorcycle trishaws that her sons maintain and operate to transport passengers. Furthermore, Julia sells clothes in various locations in her region from 6:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. She has been conducting this activity for the past three years. She likes her work because she feels it is useful to society. With her loan, she wants to buy spare parts to maintain and repair one of her motorcycles, buy more garments to sell and then rent a location to set up her clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Julia, de 50 aÃ±os vive a lado de su esposo Pedro y sus 6 hijos que ya son adultos y trabajan. Esta familia, en uniÃ³n, busca mejorar su calidad de vida. Julia es propietaria de dos motocarros, son sus hijos los que las cuidan y manejan haciendo trasporte de pasajeros. Adicionalmente, Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa por los distintos lugares de su zona, desde las 6 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Ella lleva en esta actividad desde hace 3 aÃ±os. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que le hace sentir Ãºtil a la sociedad. Con el dinero que solicita en prÃ©stamo, quiere comprar repuestos para el mantenimiento y arreglo de una de sus motos, comprar mÃ¡s prendas para su venta, y posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa.

loan.use: Motorcycle repairs and purchase of wholesale merchandise (clothing)

loan.name: Milka Ynes

texts.es:
Milka is single and an executive secretary by trade. At 25 years old, she is a young businesswoman. She lives with her parents, who support and provide her with all the possibilities to make headway. Milka has a cold beverage business (beer and soft drinks). She started it two years ago and it has gone well so far. The store is located out of her home, and she tends to it all day long. What she likes about her job is that she learns a lot, especially the exchange of ideas with the business people who supply her store. She works hard to help her family with expenses and keep active in her business. She wants to add more products to her store selection to keep making headway and with time she hopes to transform it into a well-known place with much more traffic.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Milka es soltera, de profesiÃ³n secretaria ejecutiva, tiene 25 aÃ±os de edad, es una joven emprendedora, vive junto a sus padres, quienes le brindan apoyo en lo mÃ¡ximo de sus posibilidades para salir adelante. Milka tiene un negocio de bebidas heladas (cerveza y gaseosa), se iniciÃ³ en esta actividad hace 2 aÃ±os y le va muy bien hasta ahora. Su negocio estÃ¡ en su vivienda, atiende todo el dÃ­a. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aprende mucho y sobre todo intercambia conocimientos con las personas de las empresas que le abastecen los productos. Ella trabaja para apoyar con los gastos familiares y tener activo su negocio. Quiere implementarse con mÃ¡s producto para seguir adelante y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia.

loan.use: Supply more products to her store / Abastecimiento de producto para su negocio.

loan.name: Talita Dorca

texts.es:
Talita is 27 and the mother of two children, who are both students. She lives with her husband, Luis, who is a professor and is very supportive of her. Talita does housework until midday and in her free time she sells clothing for credit or cash. Wanting to increase her income, she began this business two years ago because she saw it as something she would be able to do and it would also mean extra income for her family. She works every day to supplement her husband's income towards household expenses and especially for her children's education. Talita wants to continue to expand her clothing business and that's why she plans to use the money from this loan to take a trip to purchase what she needs. She hopes you will lend her a hand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Talita a sus 27 aÃ±os de edad es madre de 2 hijos, los mismos que estudian, vive junto a su esposo Luis, quien es profesor y la apoya en todo. Talita es trabajadora domestica hasta el medio dÃ­a, en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa al crÃ©dito o al contado. A causa de querer incrementar su sustento econÃ³mico comenzÃ³ este negocio hace 2 aÃ±os porque vio que era factible para ella y significaba un ingreso extra para su familia. Su esfuerzo diario es para apoyar con los gastos a su esposo y sobre todo para la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos. Talita quiere seguir creciendo en este negocio de la venta de ropa, por eso que con el dinero del prÃ©stamo planea hacer un viaje y comprar lo necesario, ella espera contar con su apoyo.

loan.use: Travel to the city to purchase a variety of clothing at a lower cost.

loan.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs Felipa has works making and selling tortillas for the last 15 years. During that time she has also installed a mill, and has rented out a room in her home. Mrs Felipa would like to build her room rental business, which is why she has decided to invest in purchasing beams and galvanized metal sheets to renew the roof of the rooms. Mrs Felipa is married, and her husband works as a security guard. They have an 18 year old son who is preparing to attend the university. For this reason Mrs Felipa needs to seek out new sources of income that will allow her to support her son in his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

DoÃ±a Felipa desde hace 15 aÃ±os se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n y venta de tortillas. Con el tiempo tambiÃ©n puso un molino, y empezÃ³ a alquilar una habitaciÃ³n en su vivienda. DoÃ±a Felipa desea fortalecerse en el negocio de los alquileres de cuarto, es por eso que desea invertir en ellos, el uso del prÃ©stamo serÃ¡ para la compra de perlines y zinc para cambiarles el techo a las habitaciones. DoÃ±a Felipa es casada, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tiene un hijo de 18 aÃ±os de edad, quien ahora se prepara para entrar a la universidad, es por eso que DoÃ±a Felipa tiene que buscar nuevas fuentes de ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su hijo en los estudios universitarios

loan.use: Purchase of beams and galvanized metal sheets to re-roof rental rooms.

loan.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es:
Rosa Micaela is 36 years old. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with her husband, who works at the University of Managua. They have two children - a 14 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. Rosa has worked as an executive secretary in a health center for 4 years. She plans on finding a better job, based on the experience that she hasacquired . She would like to be able to offer her children a better lifestyle, and for this reason she is investing in improving her home. With the money that she is requesting she will install a drop ceilins in three bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Micaela tiene 36 aÃ±os de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo trabaja en una Universidad de Managua, tiene 2 hijos una mujer de 14 aÃ±os y un varÃ³n de 7 aÃ±os. Rosa se desempeÃ±a como secretaria ejecutiva de un centro de salud, tiene 4 aÃ±os de laborar en este centro. Sus planes son llegar a tener un mejor puesto producto de la experiencia que ha adquirido. Desea poder asegurarles a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio es por eso que invertirÃ¡ en el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Con el dinero solicitado instalarÃ¡ cielo falso en tres habitaciones.

loan.use: Installation of drop ceilings in three bedrooms.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Senora Juana is a humble woman who has run her small business for many years. Her small cafe sells juices and snacks, and she generates enough income to help her family cover some basic costs to survive. Even though Juana is getting older, she is still very motivated to work.

SeÃ±ora muy sencilla trabaja hace muchos aÃ±os en el rubro del servicico D. jugos, sumos y ensaldas D. frutas con la cual ayuda a su familia a cubrir los gastos necesarios para sobrevivir, la seÃ±ora ya es D. edad avanzada, pero aun tiene muchas ganas D. trabajar.

loan.use: TO REPLACE THE OLD UTENSILS IN THE CAFE KITCHEN, AND PURCHASE NEEDED INGREDIENTS AND MERCHANDISE AT WHOLESALE PRICES.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Senora D. Clases is a humble woman. Together with her ten year old daughter, they work making and selling traditional clothing. Her husband is always away working, and so she must take care of the children and play the role of both mother and father for her family.

Sra. D. Clase muy humilD., juntamente con su hijita D. 10 aÃ±os se dedican a la comercializacion D. centros para seÃ±oras D. pollera es su hijita quien le ayuda a la seÃ±ora, su esposo se encuentra constantemente D. viaje, por lo tanto la sra. Es quien mantiene a todos sus hijos y tiene el rol D. padre y madre al mismo tiempo.

loan.use: To purchase fabric needed to make the traditional skirts she sells.

loan.name: Tomas Benjamin

texts.es:
Tomas is a very responsible client who is dedicated to his work. He lives a simple and humble life with his family. His taxi business supports his family and is their only source of income. It's important that his car be in good condition for his business to be successful.

Cliente muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo, vive en forma muy sencilla y humilde con su familia, el transporte es la actividad con la que vive su familia ya que es su unico ingreso en forma actual. Pero su responsablidad y su dedicaciÃ³n se ven reflrejados en su movilidad ya que se encuentra en un buen estado y en una buena condicion.

loan.use: To pay for maintenance on his taxi. His transportation business is his family's only source of income.

loan.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Mr Ismael T. has a spare part business for. This business is the source of income for his family; he has 3 kids who are studying.

His business is lacking some spare parts and some more modern parts which he needs to give a better service to his clients, so they won't have to go elsewhere to repair their cars.

He has already had 2 loans with FVP which he has repaid punctually. Mr Ishmael T. would like a loan from Kiva to buy spare car parts.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ismael T. tiene un negocio de reparaciÃ³n de automÃ³viles. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene 3 hijos los cuales estÃ¡n estudiando.

Al negocio le estÃ¡ haciendo falta refacciones y partes mÃ¡s modernos para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y asÃ­ sus clientes no tendrÃ¡n que ir a otro lugar para que les reparen sus carros.

El ya ha tenido dos prÃ©stamos con FVP los cuales los pago puntualmente. El Sr. Ismael T. estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo a Kiva para la compra de refacciones y partes de automÃ³viles.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for his business/Compra de refacciones y partes para el negocio

loan.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas is divorced and lives with her 19-year-old daughter, who is a student. She is originally from the province of Ayaviri but has lived in Puno for the last four years, where her daughter studies at the local university. Three years ago, Ms. Felicitas rented a place to start a restaurant in order to make money to support herself and her daughter after she and her husband separated. She is very happy in her work, serving her customers her delicious stews. However, the hardest part of the job is earning enough money to buy the ingredients she needs since prices have gone up recently. Like any mother, what Felicitas most wants is to see her daughter have a good job. With the money from this loan, she plans to purchase additional ingredients so that she can prepare a wider variety of stews for her customers to enjoy. This will allow her to do more business and expand her restaurant in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas es divorciada, vive con su hija D. 19 aÃ±os la cual es estudiante. Natural D. la provincia D. Ayaviri, Felicitas, resiD. en Puno hace cuatro aÃ±os con su hija D. diecinueve aÃ±os la cual estudia en una Universidad local, doÃ±a Felicitas desD. hace tres aÃ±os alquilÃ³ un local donD. puso un restaurante para mantenerse y mantener a su hija desD. la separaciÃ³n D. su esposo.Ella es feliz atendiendo a la clientela a quien ofrece sus ricos potajes, la parte mÃ¡s difÃ­cil D. su trabajo es conseguir presupuesto para comprar los ingredientes, que en la actualidad han subido su precio. DoÃ±a Felicitas quiere ver a su hija como toda una profesional ese es su mas ansiado sueÃ±o Con el dinero, Felicitas quiere comprar mÃ¡s ingredientes para poder preparar diversidad D. potajes, y asÃ­ deleitar a sus clientes, haciendo que su negocio sea mÃ¡s concurrido y en el futuro expandir su tamaÃ±o.

loan.use: Purchase of ingredients needed to prepare her dishes.

loan.name: Erika Sandra

texts.es:
Erika is 28 and lives with her cousins, Vanesa and Yadira. Erika is a very enthusiastic young woman and wants to get ahead in life. Even though she has a college degree, she hasn't been able to get a job in her field and that's why she currently sells beauty products. Erika is from Lima but moved to Juliaca seven years ago to go to school. She works all day selling her products, since her income directly depends on the amount of orders she receives. What she likes most about her work is interacting with and talking to her customers, convincing them to buy her products. Her least favorite aspect is going door to door to collect the money. Erika works every day to create a better future for herself and to have a family in the future. With the money from the loan she's requesting, Erika will purchase additional products so she can have a greater variety and increase her sales. In the near future she would like to have her own stand to sell cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Erika tiene 28 aÃ±os, vive en la casa de sus primas Vanesa y Yadira. Es una entusiasta joven en busca de superaciÃ³n, a pesar de contar con una educaciÃ³n superior, no ha podido ejercer su carrera, por ello vende productos de belleza, es natural de la ciudad de Lima, pero desde hace siete aÃ±os reside en Juliaca a causa de sus estudios.Erika se dedica a vender todo el dÃ­a, ya que sus ganancias dependen de los pedidos que tenga, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el tener que interactuar, conversar y convencer a las clientas de que compren sus productos y lo que menos le atrae es tener que caminar de casa en casa para cobrar. Erika trabaja todos los dÃ­as para forjarse un prospero porvenir y formar una familia. Con el dinero solicitado comprara mÃ¡s productos de belleza para tener variedad de mercaderÃ­a y vender aÃºn mÃ¡s, y en un futuro cercano tener su propio stand de productos de belleza.

loan.use: Purchase of additional merchandise (cosmetics) for her business.

loan.name: Glenny Sandra

texts.es:
Glenny is 20 and lives alone in the house that her parents left her. Glenny is very eager to support herself and be an independent young woman and to that end she started selling clothing a year ago. She works all week, in the morning and afternoon, as well as on weekends at the various markets in Juliaca. Being on her own is hard for Glenny since she was used to living with her family and not having to worry about supporting herself. However, Glenny enjoys her work because it brings her a sense of freedom and independence. Glenny wants to do well with her business in order to support herself, and in the future, raise a family and give them a comfortable life. With the money from the loan, Glenny will be able to purchase more clothing and increase her sales. Also, in the future she will be able to rent a stand in a store to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Glenny tiene 20 aÃ±os vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. En su afÃ¡n de mantenerse por sÃ­ misma y ser una joven independiente, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un aÃ±o, esta venta la realiza durante toda la semana por las maÃ±anas y las tardes; los fines de semana en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca.Estar sola es muy difÃ­cil para Glenny ya que estuvo acostumbrada a vivir con su familia, y no preocuparse por su manutenciÃ³n, pero a Glenny le gusta su trabajo por que la hace sentirse libre e independizada. Glenny quiere prosperar en su negocio para auto mantenerse y formar una familia en el futuro a la cual pueda brindarle una vida confortable. Con el dinero que se facilite, Glenny podrÃ¡ comprar mÃ¡s ropa e incrementar sus ventas, para en un futuro alquilar un stand en alguna tienda comercial y ofrecer su mercaderÃ­a.

loan.use: Increase amount of merchandise (clothing) and rent a stand in the future.

loan.name: Julio CÃ©sar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar is 22 and was born in Juliaca. He is unmarried and lives with his grandparents and his aunt. He is a very lively and energetic young man. He has always lived in his hometown of Juliaca, where he grew up and went to school. He used to work at his sister's grocery store, but two years ago he decided to start his own business in order to pay for his studies. With his family's help, he set up public internet booths in his house. He runs the internet cafe in the afternoon. The best part about Julio Cesar's job is that it allows him to continue studying for a degree in civil engineering at the Juliaca city university, while at the same time earn money to cover the cost of school. He likes to use the Internet to look up information or surf the Web. The hardest part of the job is keeping the computers in good working order, since there are often problems with them. Julio Cesar works hard every day to shape a better future for himself. He plans to use the loan money to invest in the purchase of another computer. This will allow him to increase his number of customers and to start another business in the future, such as a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Julio CÃ©sar tiene 22 aÃ±os, es juliaqueÃ±o de nacimiento, no es casado y vive en la casa de sus abuelos y tÃ­a. Es un joven vivaz y muy enÃ©rgico, siempre ha vivido en su ciudad natal Juliaca, donde creciÃ³ y estudiÃ³, su hermana posee una tienda de abarrotes, en la cual trabajÃ³, pero desde hace dos aÃ±os decidiÃ³ emprender su propio negocio para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.Con la ayuda de su familia, instalÃ³ unas cabinas de Internet en su casa, las cuales administra y atiende por las tardes.Lo bueno del trabajo de Julio CÃ©sar es que le permite estudiar su carrera de IngenierÃ­a Civil en la Universidad de la ciudad de Juliaca y al mismo tiempo ganar dinero para solventar los gastos que ameritan sus estudios, le gusta aprovechar el Internet para buscar informaciÃ³n y distraerse navegando, lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es tener que mantener las mÃ¡quinas en buen funcionamiento ya que siempre se presenta algÃºn desperfecto. Julio CÃ©sar se esfuerza dÃ­a a dÃ­a para forjarse un mejor futuro. El dinero del prÃ©stamo serÃ¡ invertido en comprar una computadora mÃ¡s y asÃ­ aumentar la clientela, y en un futuro poner otro negocio, como una ferreterÃ­a.

loan.use: Purchase of an additional computer for his public internet booths.

loan.name: Debora

texts.es:
Debora is 30 years old, separated and the mother of two children: Edison, who is 8, and Andres, who is 4. She currently lives with her two children in a rented home. Debora is from Lima, the capital, but has lived in Juliaca for the last 5 years.

After finishing her secondary studies, she started working various jobs, such as lingerie sales, which she has been doing now for 8 years. She does traveling sales, going to the different areas of Juliaca to sell her products. Debora's job allows her to take care of and spend time with her sons, since she works on weekends and during the morning on weekdays. The most challenging aspect of her work is having to take along her son Edison. Since he's so young, he needs a lot of attention but at the same time she has to carry and sell her merchandise. This is quite challenging, but she likes her job because it allows her to earn the money she needs to care for her sons and be able to spend time with them also.

Debora plans to use the loan money to buy additional lingerie and increase her inventory. The extra income will allow her to give her children a better education. In the future, Debora plans to have her own stand where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Debora es una mujer de 30 aÃ±os de edad, separada de su pareja y madre de dos hijos; Edison de 8 y AndrÃ©s de 4, con los que vive actualmente en una vivienda alquilada. Ella es de la ciudad capital, Lima reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace cinco aÃ±os, culminÃ³ sus estudios secundarios y desde entonces se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes labores, en el negocio de la venta de lencerÃ­a tiene ocho aÃ±os de experiencia, ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulatoria por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. El trabajo de Debora le permite cuidar y pasar tiempo con sus hijos, ya que lo hace los dÃ­as sÃ¡bados y domingos y los demÃ¡s dÃ­as de la semana por las maÃ±anas. Lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es tener que trabajar con su hijo Edison, ya que al ser pequeÃ±o necesita de sus cuidados, y al mismo tiempo manejar la mercaderÃ­a y ofrecerla, esto se le hace complicado, pero le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite ganar dinero para mantener a sus hijos y poder pasar tiempo con ellos. Con el dinero que DÃ©bora solicita comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s lencerÃ­a para poder aumentar su mercaderÃ­a y asÃ­ poder brindarles una mejor educaciÃ³n a sus dos hijos, DÃ©bora planea en el futuro contar con su propio puesto, donde ofrecer sus prendas.

loan.use: Purchase of more merchandise (lingerie) to continue with her business.

loan.name: Alidian

texts.es:
Alidian tiene 28 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ separada de su esposo y vive con sus dos hijos Deyanira de 10 y Abner de 8. Desde que se separÃ³ de su esposo - hace dos aÃ±os - incursionÃ³ en la venta de Api (Bebida elaborada a base de maÃ­z morado), negocio en que sale adelante gracias a la colaboraciÃ³n de sus dos pequeÃ±os niÃ±os, los cuales la apoyan incondicionalmente. La venta la realiza por las tardes, ya que por las maÃ±anas se dedica a atender a sus hijos que van a la escuela.A Alidian siempre le ha gustado trabajar, le gusta mucho interactuar con la gente, ofreciendo su rico Api, pero a veces resulta difÃ­cil atenderlos a todos, ya que ella y sus niÃ±os no se abastecen para atender a toda la gente que concurre a su pequeÃ±o establecimiento. Alidian trabaja duro y parejo para darles una profesiÃ³n a sus hijos y que asÃ­ puedan sostenerse cuando sean adultos. El dinero que solicita serÃ¡ invertido netamente en su para el crecimiento de su negocio y si le va bien contratar a alguien que la ayude en la atenciÃ³n. En el futuro Alidian piensa tener sucursales de su negocio de venta de Api, por diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Alidian is 28 years old; she is separated from her husband and lives with her two sons, Deyanira, 10, and Abner, 8. Since she separated from her husband two years ago she began selling Api (drink produced from purple maize); she has been able to get ahead in this business thanks to the support of her two small children who unconditionally support it. She does the selling in the afternoons since in the mornings she devotes her time to her children who go to school. Alidian has always liked to work, interact with people, and offer them her rich Api, but at the same time it is difficult for her (with the help of her children) to serve everyone who comes to her small business. Alidian works hard to give her children the chance at a profession that will enable them to sustain themselves when they are older. The money that she asks for in a loan will be invested in her business and if all goes well she hopes to hire someone who can assist in sales. In the future Alidian hopes to have other branches of her business for the sale of Api in different areas of Juliaca.

loan.use: Increase her capital for her business.

loan.name: Edgar Eloy

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 22 aÃ±os, vive en casa con su madre. AprendiÃ³ desde muy niÃ±o - viendo a su madre - el negocio de los tejidos a mÃ¡quina, del cual ahora es partÃ­cipe, poniÃ©ndole muchas ganas, ya que toda la experiencia ganada durante todos estos aÃ±os le han servido para crear sus peculiares modelos.Edgar trabaja durante toda la semana para confeccionar sus prendas y las vende los dÃ­as sÃ¡bado y domingos en las ferias de la ciudad. Aunque resulte extraÃ±o - en un hombre - a Edgar le gusta el tejer, solo que algunas veces le resulta complicado la combinaciÃ³n de colores y puntos para lo cual le pide ayuda a su madre. Con el dinero que se le pueda facilitar, Edgar invertirÃ¡ en comprar otras mÃ¡quinas, ademÃ¡s de variedades de lanas para poder hacer crecer su producciÃ³n y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre que con los aÃ±os ya no puede trabajar como lo hacia en su juventud.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Edgar is 22 years old and lives at home with his mother. As a child he learned to machine weave textiles by watching his mother; now he uses his experience to create interesting models, weaving with much enthusiasm. Edgar works all week to make his garments and sells them on Saturday and Sunday in fairs throughout the city. Although it is strange for a man, Edgar enjoys weaving; however he often asks his mother for help as he has trouble creating combination of colors. With the money he is asking for as a loan, Edgar plans to invest in the purchase of another weaving machine as well as a variety of wool that will allow him to help increase their production and provide a better quality of life to his mother since she can no longer work as she did in her youth.

loan.use: Purchase of raw material for the production of their textiles.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 28 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo Francisco y sus tres hijos de ocho, cinco y dos aÃ±os. Desde muy niÃ±a aprendiÃ³ y ayudÃ³ en el trabajo de sus padres con el ganado, teniendo que dejar la escuela primaria en cuarto grado, es asÃ­ que hoy en dÃ­a, con una familia por mantener se dedica a la a la venta de ganado ovino y a la elaboraciÃ³n de quesos que fabrica en su casa, de la leche que dan sus animales, los cuales vende los dÃ­as domingos en la feria.A Isabel siempre le ha gustado el comercio, su soltura y su manera de convencer a la gente para que compre sus productos, se han convertido en sus armas fundamentales para su negocio, lamentablemente los ingredientes para fabricar sus quesos y el poco ganado que le queda hace que el negocio sea mÃ¡s difÃ­cil de mantener. Sus tres hijos son su razÃ³n de ser, por la que ella trabaja tan duramente dÃ­a a dÃ­a. Isabel con el dinero que pide prestado piensa comprar muchas mÃ¡s cabezas de ganado para incrementar la venta y la producciÃ³n de queso, y asÃ­ concretizar su sueÃ±o de un negocio mÃ¡s rentable y productivo.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel is 28 years old and lives with her husband Francisco and their three sons who are 8, 5, and 2 years old. Since she was a very little girl she began helping her parents with their cows, thus having to leave primary school in fourth grade. Today, with a family to maintain, she less cows, sheep and cheese at the markets on Sunday. She makes the cheese at home from the milk of her animals. Isabel has always liked business and her ability to convince people to buy her products has become a critical weapon for her business; unfortunately the ingredients needed to manufacture the cheeses and the few cows that she has left have made it more difficult for her to maintain her business. Her three children are her reason for being and for them she works hard every day. With the money that Isabel is asking for as a loan she is considering buying more heads of cattle to increase the sale and production of her cheese and as such realize her dream of making her business more profitable and productive.

loan.use: Increase her number of heads of cattle.

loan.name: Ela

texts.es:
Ela tiene 33 aÃ±os, vive en la casa de su madre, a la cual considera su mayor fuente de apoyo. Se dedica esporÃ¡dicamente a la venta ropa, pero la labor que le genera mejores ingresos econÃ³micos es la venta de leÃ±a, la cual vende desde su casa, con la ayuda de su madre.Ela viene realizando este trabajo desde hace 7 aÃ±os, tiempo en el cual reside en la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que naciÃ³ en una comunidad en las afueras de la ciudad, aÃºn es soltera y disfruta de su trabajo, el cual le permite ayudar a su mamÃ¡, lo difÃ­cil es tener que partir la leÃ±a, esto le genera un mayor esfuerzo fÃ­sico. Ela se esfuerza demasiado para poder brindarle a su madre una vida digna y un esperanzador futuro para ella. Piensa invertir el dinero que se le facilite en comprar mÃ¡s leÃ±a para poder hacer mÃ¡s productivo su negocio y tener en el futuro un local y otro negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Ela is 33 years old; she lives in her mother's house which she considers to be her greatest source of support. She has sporadically worked selling clothes, but the work that generates the majority of her income is the sale of firewood which she sells from her home with the help of her mother. Ela has been doing this since she moved to the city of Juliaca, 7 years; she was born in a community on the outskirts of the city. She is still unmarried and enjoys her work, which allows her to help her mother; the most difficult part is splitting the wood, which requires significant physical effort. Ela strives to give her mother a decent life and a hopeful future for herself. She is considering investing her money so that she can purchase more firewood which would allow their business to be more productive and in the future they would be able to have another location and another business.

loan.use: Increase the amount of firewood for her business

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo Enrique de 25 aÃ±os, el cual es artesano y su hijo Miguel de 6 aÃ±os. Nancy se dedica desde hace cinco aÃ±os al tejido de chompas, pantalones, etc. en su casa donde tiene su mÃ¡quina de tejer, para luego vender estas prendas en el mercado donde tiene su pequeÃ±o puesto.Usualmente vende las prendas confeccionadas los dÃ­as sÃ¡bados y en la feria dominical donde gustosamente ofrece la mercaderÃ­a elaborada durante la semana, lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil de su trabajo es la confecciÃ³n de las prendas, las cuales demandan tiempo y dedicaciÃ³n. El motivo de tanto trabajo es apoyar a su esposo Enrique y su pequeÃ±o hijo Miguel de tan solo 6 aÃ±os a los cuales quiere ofrecer una vida digna y feliz.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy is 31 years old and lives with her husband Henry who is 25 and works as an artisan; she also lives with her son Michael who is 6 years old. For the past five years Nancy has woven sweaters and pants from her home where she has her weaving machine; she then sells these garments in the market where she has a small stand. She usually sells the woven garments at the fair where she gladly offers the merchandise that is produced during the week; the most difficult part of her job is the production of the garments, which requires time and dedication. The reason she is so dedicated to this work is that she works to support her husband and her son Miguel who is only 6 years old since she wants to offer him a happy and dignified life.

loan.use: Purchase of raw material (wool) for the production of her clothing.

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos Mariana de 12 aÃ±os y Owen de 5. Alejandrina dejÃ³ su natal Patambuco, para buscarse un mejor porvenir en la ciudad de Juliaca, donde reside hace un aÃ±o con sus dos pequeÃ±os hijos, para solventar sus gastos se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa durante todo el dÃ­a, de forma ambulatoria.Le gusta vender ropa ya que es un trabajo que le permite ser independiente, la desventaja es que a veces, por falta de presupuesto, no puede adquirir las cantidades de ropa que el pÃºblico demanda. Alejandrina se esfuerza dÃ­a a dÃ­a con el Ãºnico propÃ³sito de sacar adelante y ver profesionales a sus dos menores hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandrina is a single mother who lives with her two sons Mariana, 12, and Owen, 5. Alejandrina left her home, Patambuco, to look for a better future in the city of Juliaca where she has lived for over a year with her two young children. In order to pay for their expenses she sells clothing all day in the informal market. She likes selling clothes because it is a job that allows her to be independent; the disadvantage is that sometimes, due to her lack of capital, she is not able to acquire the amount of clothing that the public demands. Alejandrina works ever day for the sole purpose of giving her children a better life and allowing them to become professionals.

loan.use: Increase the amount of clothing she sells in order to increase her profits.

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 42 years old, divorced, and now lives on her own. She has lived in the city of Juliaca for 31 years, having left her own village to look for a better life in a bigger city. Since then, she has worked making and selling textiles, a business which has supported her all these years. As she was unable to finish her education, she was not able to pursue a more formal profession.

Alejandrina likes her work. She first learned to sew from her mother, who taught her many important things such as believing in herself. She works hard to make sure she has a good future as she gets older. With the loan, she will be able to grow her business, purchase the material she needs and maybe even open her own small shop in the future, where she could work with other women who like Alejandrina, have been strong and capable on their own.

Alejandrina tiene 42 aÃ±os, es divorciada y vive sola, ya que no tuvo hijos. Ella reside en Juliaca hace 31 aÃ±os, partiÃ³ de su pueblo para buscarse una mejor vida en la ciudad, desde entonces se ha dedicado a la venta de prendas tejidas a mÃ¡quina, negocio que le ha servido para mantenerse durante toda su vida, ya que al no terminar su primaria no se pudo valer de armas para forjarse un futuro profesional.A Alejandrina le gusta su trabajo, el tejer se lo enseÃ±Ã³ su madre, de la cual aprendiÃ³ muchas cosas, como valerse por sÃ­ misma, pero como toda labor tambiÃ©n tiene su parte difÃ­cil, en este caso es terminar la producciÃ³n de sus prendas. Alejandrina trabaja para forjarse un mejor futuro y asegurar su vejez. Con el prÃ©stamo, esta valiente mujer podrÃ¡ agrandar su negocio, comprando materiales y si es posible poner un taller en el futuro, donde pueda dar trabajo a otras mujeres que como ella que siempre se han valido solas.

a Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL NEEDED TO MAKE HER TEXTILES, GROW HER BUSINESS, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT HERSELF.

loan.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 39 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two sons; Guido, who is 20, and Joel, who is 12, both of whom attend school. To help support her family, Ana has worked for 20 years selling shoes around the city of Juliaca. Her business has grown thanks to the various styles of shoes she offers to her customers. She travels to other cities such as Ayaviri, Puno to sell her shoes, and also works in local city markets.

Ana likes her work, but the constant travel makes things difficult for her. She would like to set up small stands in the main markets she visits, and so she is requesting a loan to purchase inventory and continue to grow her business.

Ana tiene 39 aÃ±os, es separada y vive con sus dos hijos, Guido D. 20 aÃ±os y Joel D. 12, quienes son estudiantes. Ella se dedica, desD. hace 20 aÃ±os, a la venta D. calzado, para poder mantener a su familia, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria al por mayor y menor en la ciudad D. Juliaca, los novedosos y variados diseÃ±os hacen que el negocio D. Ana estÃ© creciendo y obtenga mÃ¡s clientela D. la que ya tiene. Ella viaja a ofrecer su mercaderÃ­a a las ciudades D. Ayaviri, Puno y venD. en las ferias dominicales D. la ciudad, le gusta su trabajo, pero el tener que viajar tanto con su mercaderÃ­a, la cual es un poco pesada se le hace difÃ­cil. Ana quiere tener un puesto en cada uno D. los diferentes mercados D. las ciudades que ella visita, es asÃ­ que con el dinero que ella solicita piensa comprar mucha mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a y poder incrementar su capital y su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: TO PURCHASE INVENTORY TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS SELLING SHOES. AS A SINGLE MOTHER, ANA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR EDUCATING AND TAKING CARE OF HER TWO SONS ON HER OWN.

loan.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 51 years old. She's a single mother and lives with her 22 year old daughter, who is attending college. Cristina is a native of the city of Desaguadero. She was not able to complete her education because she had to work to help her family's economic situation. She's lived in the city of Juliaca for 17 years now, during which she's worked at different jobs. But for the last 10 years, thanks to a lot of hard work, she was able to open her own small shop in her house selling everyday grocery and household items.

Cristina likes her work in the shop as it allows her to work from home. The difficult part is always having to stock more products to sell, as it's hard to predict how much she needs and it's expensive to overstock. Cristina works hard to make sure her daughter has an education and can pursue a profession. With the requested loan, she will be able to stock her small store with many more products, better serve her customers and grow the business.

Cristina tiene 51 aÃ±os, es madre soltera y vive con su hija de 22 aÃ±os, la cual estÃ¡ cursando sus estudios universitarios. Cristina es natural de la ciudad de Desaguadero, no pudo terminar sus estudios primarios porque desde muy pequeÃ±a tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para ayudar en la economÃ­a familiar, vive en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 17 aÃ±os, tiempo en el cual ha venido trabajando en diferentes actividades, pero desde hace 10 aÃ±os y gracias a su duro esfuerzo Cristina pudo poner una pequeÃ±a tienda de abarrotes.A Cristina le gusta trabajar en su tiendita, ya que le permite estar en casa y tener un trabajo mÃ¡s tranquilo, lo difÃ­cil es tener que abastecerse cada mes de los productos que venderÃ¡ en su tienda, ya que a veces el presupuesto no le alcanza para poder surtirla como ella quisiera. Cristina trabaja con el fiel pensamiento de sacar a su hija profesional y que pueda desarrollarse como tal. Con el dinero que solicita desea abastecer su tiendita con muchos mÃ¡s productos y variados para complacer a su clientela, asÃ­ poder tener un negocio mÃ¡s rentable y que le dÃ© mayores frutos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: TO GROW HER PRODUCT INVENTORY, OFFER MORE SELECTION TO HER CUSTOMERS AND GROW HER BUSINESS.

loan.name: Mrs. Sin Sophea"s Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is the Village Bank President of a group of nine people who live in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. She is a pig breeder who is raising only one pig right now because she does not have enough money to purchase more pigs. Since her business has been going well, Mrs. Sin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets. She plans to use any remainder of the loan to purchase pig feed to feed them.

Her husband, Mr. Ly Mak, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sin S. is 28 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending school while the other is still too young because that child is under the age of five years old.

loan.use: to buy piglets and to purchase pig feed

loan.name: Mrs. Chea Chanthoeun's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C. is the Village Bank President of a group of eight members who are all in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. She is a cake seller in the local village. Since her business activity is going well, Mrs. Chea C. is requesting a loan to buy more cakes to resell them.

Her husband, Mr. Sin Saron, is a motorbike taxi driver who can only make a small income, not enough to support his family. Mrs. Chea C. is 29 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending primary school while the younger one is too young to work or study.

loan.use: to buy more cakes to resell

loan.name: Mrs. Korng Oeun's Group

texts.en: This group consists of four members who live in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Korng O. is the group leader and she is a fruit seller. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Korng O. wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit in order to reach her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Srey Khorn, is a house construction foreman. Mrs. Korng O. has two children who are both attending school.

loan.use: to buy more fruit to re-sell

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. is 55 years old. After losing her husband at a young age, she struggled to raise her children who now all have finished school and have grown. She has been a member since 2006. Her initial loan of 2.000.000d was used to purchase hogs in hope to support her family financially. After seeing the success of her business, she became more confident and seeks more loans to help with her business. The profits gained and loan she received thereafter was used to expand her business and she was even able to buy hens-to lay eggs. At this present time, her livestock consists of 7 pigs and 200 hens. Her daily income is about 200.000d. Three of her five children are grown and are living on their own. The other 2 children reside with her and both have steady jobs with a 3.000.000d/month income. This time she is requesting a loan of 6.000.000 to invest in farm animals. Her average income is 5.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Pigs

loan.name: Mr. Chea Kark's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chea K. is the group leader of four people who all live in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. In the rainy season, Mr. Chea K. grows rice, while he grows vegetables in the dry season. On his plantation, Mr. Chea K. now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer to support the rice field. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use part of the loan to buy pesticide to kill insects in order to make his crop more productive.

Mr. Chea K. is a widower with eight children, one of whom is working as a construction worker while six others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy pesticide

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi N., 25 years of age, has been a member since 2003. Since becoming a member of this loan program, she has invested in mat making and livestock. The family income has rise and fluctuates daily. Her first loan of 1.000.000d was used to invest in livestock and mat making. As a result, she was able to invest more capital into her livestock business and purchased more materials for mat weaving. Every day her husband works as a construction worker with an average daily income of 80.000d. Presently, she plans to borrow this loan to help remodel the animalsâ€™ pen. She is requesting a loan of 6.000.000d. Her average monthly income is 4.000.000d.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

texts.en:
Mrs Nguyá»…n Thá»‹ Tuáº¥n is 49 years old. Before joining TYM fund, her family was going through difficult time: big family, her children did not have stable jobs so they could not help her much. In 2007, she joined TYM fund. Her first loan was for 2.000.000 VND. She bought 2 calves, kept them for a year then sold them for 3.000.000 VND. Then with the money from the sale, she invested in raising pigs & ducks. Currently she has 2 breeding cows, 8 pigs and a paddle of 200 egg laying ducks. Now her family annual income is 50.000.000 VND. Her children are all grown up and hold a stable job, their income is 4.000.000 VND a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 7.000.000 to invest more in her pig & duck business. Her family monthly income is 6.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raise pigs & ducks

loan.name: Pham Thi

Thu nháº­p bÃ¬nh quÃ¢n. 6.000.000Ä‘/ thÃ¡ng.
texts.en:
Mrs Pháº¡m Thá»‹ Quyáº¿t is 46 years old. She's aTYM fund member since 2004. After 4 rounds of loans, her family financial situation has improved. Before joining TYM, her family living condition was difficult since their only income is from their land. When she joined TYM, she used her loan to raise pigs, chickens and ducks. Their living condition has improved, they are now able to buy things that they need and repairtheir house. Her children are all grown up and they chip in financially. They contribute 3.000.000 a month. This time Mrs Quyáº¿t is requesting a loan of 9.000.000 vnd. Her family income is 6.000.000 vnd a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Pigs

loan.name: Phan Thi

texts.en:
Mrs Phan Thá»‹ C. is 41 years old. She's a TYM fund member since 2005. Like many other families in the region, her family income comes from their exploited land and their pig raising business. Because they did not have enough capital to invest in the pig business, it did not yield enough income for her family. In 2005, she joined TYM to get a loan and she invested all in her pig business. She built new pig pen and expanded the operation. This has been a success. Things have changed for the better. Her family financial situation has improved a lot. She has been able to buy all the necesary goods for her household. She and her husband work hard, when they have free time they go to work for other farmers. This could bring in extra 100.000 VND a day. This time Ms C. is requesting a loan of 6.000.000 to invest in her pig business. Her family income is 5.000.000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raise pigs

loan.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Huong, 42 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. She borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000VND (125USD) to invest in her small general store in the market. Her daily income from this is about 100,000VND (6.25USD). Since joining the Fund, the income from this business has been higher. Besides the store, she also invests in rearing pigs. This is also the main source of income for her family, as every year she can sell 3 rounds of pigs, each round 3 tonnes, yielding a profit of about 35,000,000VND (2187.50USD). This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to continue investing in rearing pigs. Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (312.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Rearing pigs

loan.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Ly, 40 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007 with the goal of improving her family's financial situation. Her first loan of 5,000,000VND (312.50USD) was used to invest in rearing pigs. Realizing the high profit gained, her family decided to renovate the pig sty to continue rearing pigs in a large scale. Since then, her family members have been putting more effort into work. Her husband also works as a construction worker with the monthly income of 2,000,000VND (125USD). Mrs. Ly sometimes works as cleaner for the village's administration house for the monthly income of 1,000,000VND (62.50USD). With these stable incomes, her family has always been able to repay the loan fully. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in rearing pigs. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (250USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Rearing pigs

loan.name: Thi Tho

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Tho, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Her husband is a construction worker with the stable monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD). She has 2 children currently studying in college. She started borrowing loans to rear pigs so that her family's income could increase and that she would be able to send her children to school. Her effort is paid off as she is now able to sell the pigs after every 3 months. She wants to purchase breeding pigs so that she will not have to buy piglets to rear every time. This time round, she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD). Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 312.50USD).
